Package com.csd4020.view

Class PlayerInfoPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.csd4020.view.PlayerInfoPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class PlayerInfoPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A UI class representing the Player Info panel which holds all necessary player info such as the player's name, active & inactive cards as well as buttons for interacting with the board.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • populateLayout

        private void populateLayout()

      • disableCard

        private void disableCard​(java.lang.String cardName)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Visually "disables" the card matching the passed card name to indicate that it has been used.
        Parameters:
        cardName - The name of the card to be disable Precondition: cardName is a valid card name (i.e. Professor) Postcondition: The selected card will be visually "disabled"
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When an invalid card name is given

      • setUpCard

        public void setUpCard​(java.lang.String cardName,
                      boolean hasBeenPlayed)
        Enables or disables the card matching the given card name based on the value of hasBeenPlayed.
        Parameters:
        cardName - The card's name
        hasBeenPlayed - True if it has been played, false otherwise

      • enableCard

        private void enableCard​(java.lang.String cardName)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Visually "enables" the card matching the passed card name to indicate that the card can be used.
        Parameters:
        cardName - The name of the card to enable Precondition: cardName is a valid card name (i.e. Professor) Postcondition: The selected card will be visually "enabled"
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When an invalid card name is given

      • setPlayerName

        public void setPlayerName​(java.lang.String name)
        Updates the player's name with the passed value.
        Parameters:
        name - The player's name to update the view with Precondition: Name != null Postcondition: The player's name will be updated
